result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All costs to be paid FORTHWITH - in lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 9 days in the Waukesha County Jail -  consecutive to the 90 days - 9 days credit - Time Served - Paid in Full.

Court orders 90 days in Waukesha County Jail concurrent to his present prison sentence. 90 days credit. Time served.
Defendant to be return to Dodge Correctional Institute - FORTHWITH
Concurrent with: Present sentence

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jordan T Jones in court, in custody (OTP'd from DCI), with attorney Joseph Smith.   
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to his present prison sentence.
90 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample - Court Waives
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of payment an additional 9 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive to the 90 Days - 9 Days Credit - Paid in Full.

Defendant to be returned to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Detainer placed at Dodge Correctional Institution.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional Institution.

Defendant Jordan T Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for continued preliminary hearing. Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jordan T Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Scott Wheeler from the City of Oconomowoc Police Department sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Smith. State requests to adjourn hearing for more testimony from another witness. Atty. Smith has no objection. Court adjourns hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
